meanings.definition: a small bag or packet containing a small amount of something, such as a powder or perfume
meanings.sent1: I opened the sachet of sugar for my tea.
meanings.sent2: She placed the sachet of lavender in her drawer to keep it smelling nice.
meanings.sent3: The sachet of herbs made the whole room smell like a garden!
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a sachet of sweetness in the midst of chaos.
meanings.sent5: The sachet of spices added a burst of flavor to the dish.

meanings.definition: to put something in a sachet
meanings.sent1: I will sachet the potpourri to give it a lovely scent.
meanings.sent2: She sacheted the dried flowers to preserve their fragrance.
meanings.sent3: He sacheted the ingredients together for a delightful surprise.
meanings.sent4: The chef sacheted the special blend of seasonings for the dish.
meanings.sent5: Sacheting the perfume carefully ensured it stayed fresh.
